sisop

Class SynchPort<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sisop.SynchPort<T>

  • public class SynchPort<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implement a generic synchronized port, using FairSemaphore, compared to type

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SynchPort(int nMitt)
      Create a synchronized port for the required senders

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      sisop.Message<T> receiveFrom()
      Receive, if there is at least one, a message from the synchronized port; otherwise it will be blocked
      void sendTo(T message, java.lang.String name)
      Send a message to the synchronized port.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SynchPort

        public SynchPort(int nMitt)
        Create a synchronized port for the required senders
        Parameters:
        nMitt - Number of senders that will use the port

    • Method Detail

      • sendTo

        public void sendTo(T message,
          java.lang.String name)
        Send a message to the synchronized port. In the buffer will be saved, addition to the message, the name of the sender thread
        Parameters:
        message - The message that must be sent
        name - The name of the sender thread

      • receiveFrom

        public sisop.Message<T> receiveFrom()
        Receive, if there is at least one, a message from the synchronized port; otherwise it will be blocked
        Returns:
        A Message object that contains the message (Message.message) and the name of the sender thread (Message.threadName)
